Class ActionButton

  • java.lang.Object
    • greenfoot.Actor
      • ActionButton

  • public abstract class ActionButton
extends greenfoot.Actor
    The ActionButton class. You should NEVER construct anything of type ActionButton (turns out, you actually cannot do so). Instead, you should:
    • 1) create a new subclass of ActionButton
    • 2) remove the act() method from the subclass.
    • 3) add a constructor for your subclass. You'll probably want this constructor to call ActionButton's constructor, likley similar to: super("Click Me");
    • 4) add a public method called performAction that does not take any parameters and returns nothing. This method will be called whenever "this" button is clicked. Remember, "this" button is in a world and you likely added methods to that world class.
    Although you are welcome to modify this code, modifying this code is HIGHLY INADVISABLE.
    Version:
    2/2019
    Author:
    Stephen Blythe
